text:
Hello everyone,
I'm super admin in a HS portal where I want to activate the public beta "CRM development tools to build UI extensions with React as frontend". However, I can't join it, hovering over the join button I'm reading "contact your super admin to join".
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> We want to copy text from a JS variable/function. The text has formatted HTML in it which users can paste in an email and send out
I can confirm that I have the same issue.

Hi <@U02DYFPJH4J> this is actually a better pattern for projects / UI Extensions since we have a GitHub integration at the repo level and changes isolated to your primary branch can trigger new builds and deploys automatically in HubSpot if you are currently using that for code management.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/link-a-github-repository-to-a-project>
So itâ€™s better to put the Custom Extension project in one repo separate from any other application?
In most cases yes. If you plan to build multiple extensions there might some other considerations to make.

<@U062K01D0GJ> can you confirm these?
1. Your account is opted-in to the CRM development tools beta
2. You have latest version of CIL
Can you send the account id?
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> thank you for the reply, after joining the beta on the account I managed to upload the project

I see no "CRM development" tab on the upper menu, that's why I thought I couldn't create custom cards with UI extensions.
But... if I click on "Projects" on the bottom bar I see this
I managed to create a project locally but after I ran `hs project upload` I got this error
I can see the project on the HS portal though, it's just empty. Maybe I need the beta enabled then...

Thanks for the reply.
Currently, I'm using Rollup to transpile and bundle my backend project, requiring me to set my app.function's package type to module.
This caused an error while performing local development because *.js files were being interpreted as ES6 modules unless they have a .cjs file extension.
This works perfectly while developing local but for some reason the hs build and deploy process strictly adheres to a .js file extension requirement but the error doesn't state the file extension is not supported (though it's just commonJS JavaScript, the exact format the serverless process requires) , it says it can't be found; a bit confusing.
Anyways, I was able to resolve the issue by adding a package.json file to my output folder (where my build/bundle artifacts are generated) with a type of "commonjs" and changed the file extensions to .js.  This fixed the local development and hs deployment issues.

Thanks again for your help
